item.title: BloodHound Neo4j
item.description: TAKE A SNAPSHOT BEFORE ATTEMPTING THIS. I would highly recommend installing Neo4j using the repository. Neo4j is a database for bloodhound API. I had a couple of issues installing this. had some issues with multiple versions of Java running. currently, neo4k only runs on Java 8 kali currently comes with 11.x. need to tell java to use the legacy version. Next, need to add the repository to download neo4j. ##### echo "deb http://httpredir.

item.title: FTP
item.description: File transfer protocol is a terrible service and you should never run it without some kind of protection in front of it. I’ve bumped into quite a few boxes running FTP. I often forget all the commands you can run with ftp. mget * download everything in the directory get download file / documents put upload file / documents nmap (maybe even in intereactive mode) SSHFS & SFTP SSHFS is built on SFTP.

item.title: Hugo/Github/Power
item.description: POWERSHELL Overview, how to install Hugo and how to set up the web pages using GitHub as repository in a WINDOWS environment. Since most of the commands have a Linux counterpart you could follow. First off id like to say I wish there was a way to do this with less command line. I initially tried setting it up on GITLAB but I just couldn’t find the material I need to do within windows.

item.title: Network Manager Down
item.description: The weirdest glitch bug I’ve ever experienced I am not sure I how I deleted the icon but it disappeared I could no longer access the network manager. Well fix the problem and see how to get to the internet without the network manager. I’m not sure if completely removing the network manager is required but i purged it out. sudo apt-get purge network-manager To gain internet access even though the network manager is down and isn’t connected.

item.title: SqlMap
item.description: SqlMap automates finding sql-injection it can use GET or POST request. It’s pretty neat. In burp right click select copy to file, this will test for sql injection. pretty cool wasn’t aware it would test all the parameters. sqlmap –batch -r login.req sqlmap --batch -u "http://os.htb/users/admin*" --level 5 --risk 3 -u url also for get request --batch run default yes --* = the parameter to fuzz --dump , --dump-all dumping sqldb to a localfile in /
